Returns: A Source object, or null if the href cannot be resolved, and the processor should try to resolve the URI itself.
Parameters: String: An href attribute, which may be relative or absolute.
String: The base URI against which the first argument will be made absolute if the absolute URI is required.
Throws: if an error occurs when trying to resolve the URI.
resolve(java.lang.String, java.lang.Stri.Description: Called by the processor when it encounters an xsl:include, xsl:import, or document() function.
resolve(java.lang.String, java.lang.Stri.FullName: public abstract Source resolve (String href, String base)

resolve(java.lang.String,java.lang.Strin.FullName: public abstract Source resolve (String href, String base)

ClassDesc: An object that implements this interface that can be called by the processor to turn a URI used in document(), xsl:import, or xsl:include into a Source object.
